error.signature: STOPPED (Essential container in task exited) - CannotPullContainerError or ResourceInitializationError

verdict.summary: Fargate task stopped due to image pull failure, resource initialization error, or container crash.

dead_ends.action: Increase task CPU/memory to fix CannotPullContainerError
dead_ends.why_fails: Image pull errors are network or permission issues, not resource limits

dead_ends.action: Restart the ECS service to fix persistent task failures
dead_ends.why_fails: Service restart re-launches the same task definition; configuration errors persist

workarounds.action: Check stopped task reason and container exit code in ECS console or CLI
For CannotPullContainerError: ensure task execution role has ECR access and VPC has NAT gateway or VPC endpoints
workarounds.how: Attach AmazonECSTaskExecutionRolePolicy to execution role; verify subnet has internet access for ECR pulls

leads_to.condition: Repeated task failures trigger service unable to place tasks

preceded_by.condition: ECR authentication issues cause container image pull failures

frequently_confused_with.distinction: Unable to place is about scheduling/resources; Fargate task failed is about the task itself failing after placement
